title: Library should open new tab when click item in library
content:
I am very happy with the upgraded Firefox library. It works great except for one feature. Maybe there is a setting for it that I have missed.

When I click on an item in my library to open it, it opens it over top of the right-most tab that I have open. That means I always have to be careful to have a blank tab open, otherwise I lose the last item I was viewing. Is there a setting, or can you add a setting, to have the library open links in a new tab, or if one prefers in the existing tab? I want to be able to open in new tabs.
creator: eberger5

title: audio goes in and out and changes volumn watching sling espn live feed on windows 11 hp laptop

title: Picture-in-picture player umutes itself
content:
I am using Firefox's picture-in-picture player to watch a livestream on Youtube. When I use the mute button on the PiP controls, it will unmute itself after a few seconds. Instead, I have to find the browser tab and mute it in YouTube's player. Would be nice to have a this resolved as the mute button on the PiP player is more convenient to use. Thanks, I appreciate this cool feature.

Screenshot is just to indicate the mute button I'm referring to - hard to capture the problematic behavior in a screenshot.
creator: ryanbickett

title: BUG cannot disable control+period in mozilla/multi-account-containers
content: Cannot disable ctrl+period shortcut in mozilla/multi-account-cointainers extension. Not that you will care.

title: Change Search Data Input
content:
Hi Everyone, I've just installed (clean) version 115.0.2, and can't get back to my previous layout. The default engine is set to DuckDuckGo, and Privacy Essentials is installed too. Although the front page of FireFox shows a search box in the main body, when I type into it, the information is transferred to the DDG search box in the Toolbar. How can I get back to where things were before -- i.e. I could type into the main page box and DDG would happily search from there. Thank you,

Ian
creator: ian_sd57llg

title: Updating FF, using Mac 10.12.6:  Will ESR happen automatically?
content:
I have Mac 10.12.6 on an "early 2009" 27" iMac. I'm waiting for the new 27/32inch iMac until I upgrade hardware and operating system. The release notes with FF V115 say in part " Users on those operating systems will be migrated to the ESR 115 version of Firefox."

I want to clarify that when I update to FF 116, FF will automatically install the ESR version, or will I need to do this manually? Also, will this update take a long time, like FF will be installing a totally new (ESR) version, rather than "just" the usual update?
creator: cglenn

title: problem experienced with a website
content: Hi, I regularly use https://community.railwaymodellers.com but yesterday found that I could no longer post items or add comments to posts. It will let me add photos and "likes" but not let me add any text or create a new post. It was suggested by their admin that I try a different browser and I can confirm that if I access using 'Chrome' then I don't have this problem. They have also said that one of their other members has also reported an issue using Firefox... so this suggests that something has changed at Firefox during the past 24hrs to cause this issue. Any thoughts? Regards, Ian Perrin
creator: ian_perrin

title: Authentication Key
content: My computer crashed and I had to reset my account. For some reason the password that I was 99% sure was correct didn't work so in order to change my password it said I need an authentication key. I didn't recall getting one of those so I reset my password (even though it said on the screen I would only lose things like passwords and history). I of course lost all my bookmarks that I've been collecting for the last 20 years. And as life goes I've now found the authentication key. My question is can I get anything back now that I have that key or all my bookmarks are forever deleted?

title: Connessione sicura non riuscita
content:
Connessione sicura non riuscita

Si è verificato un errore durante la connessione a idp.accessogiustizia.it. Il peer SSL non è stato in grado di negoziare un insieme di parametri di sicurezza accettabile.

Codice di errore: SSL_ERROR_HANDSHAKE_FAILURE_ALERT 

   La pagina che si sta cercando di visualizzare non può essere mostrata in quanto non è possibile verificare l’autenticità dei dati ricevuti.    Contattare il responsabile del sito web per informarlo del problema.

COME POSSO RISOLVERE QUESTO PROBLEMA?

title: Add-ons's notification sound is muted
content: I don't like the way Firefox uses Windows Action Center to show notifications, so I disabled it by changing alerts.useSystemBackend to false. The problem is Firefox built-in notification system just decides to remove any sound at all and only shows the notifications. It's annoying especially when I'm using this [add-on]. I really need to hear the notification sound. Please help me to bring the sounds back. Thank you.
creator: Duc1790

title: Mysterious pinned tabs keep appearing in my browser (for random somewhat spammy-looking websites). How can I stop them?
content:
I've been noticing for the last month that after a few hours in a browser window, I'll suddenly have a pinned tab for some random website. Some for promotional things, others in languages I don't understand, etc. At first I downloaded a webpage blocker, blocked the ones that were pinned, and deleted the tabs. However, after a short while (an hour or two) they would appear again in pinned tabs only this time it would say website blocked.

I uninstalled and reinstalled firefox in hopes that would solve the issue, but it is still happening. I unpin the tabs and delete them immediately after I notice them, but they keep appearing. I really like using Firefox and use it often for work, but I'm concerned for my personal and work security. What should I do?
creator: estina

title: Browser Crashes after every use

title: Bookmarks gone with an Overwritten backup.
content:
I had to do a full on reinstall of windows early this morning. Once that was all done I re-downloaded everything I was using before. Once I had installed everything I hopped on FireFox and had started to browse through my bookmarks. I had all of them in one folder but not another in the bookmark sidebar you can open with ctrl+b. So I went to manage bookmarks and went on to import/backup. I had a backup from around 2:30am today and that's the one I had tried using because this was before the time I had started to reinstall windows. I must have looked at something wrong because I have now completely overwritten my backup.

I still have all logins and history from the past 6 months I just lost my bookmarks by overwriting them myself by mistake. 

I've tried to go to the bookmark and restore it to a previous version but it doesn't appear to have one.

Just to clear up on the full reinstall I had to completely reformat my drives therefore I no longer had access to any Windows.old folders to go searching through.

I've included a few pictures to help show what I'm looking at whether or not they'll be helpful. I hope I'm not to SoL on this one but if I am it can't be helped.
creator: MHatter
